title: Bureau
author: Bureau
content: Scammers have been targeting our local board, and we as a community have been idle. It resulted in a newbie posting a scam platform. None of the global moderators deleted this topic, nor have any active members @pakhitheboss, @elevates, @IIrik11, and merit source @Heisenberg_Hunter. I would say it is pretty clear that none of them want anything to do with the local board as none of them might have reported this guy.If these individuals had reported this issue, then I imagine this topic would have been deleted. Considering the attitude of these individuals, I think it is high time that @theymos should consider a mod for the Indian board. I am ready to do it if considered, as I have not seen anyone or @eaLiTy (recommended name) being active on this board.Reference - üèÜ It‚Äôs a race to the top! üöÄ Win $2500 worth of prizes! üí∞Thanks.

comments.author: Heisenberg_Hunter
comments.body: We have been requesting for a dedicated moderator for almost 3+ years but I don't think it is as easy as it seem to be. Bitcointalk is the oldest and most respected crypto forum on the internet and theymos considers a lot of factors before appointing some random internet stranger as a moderator. As bitcointalk involves with dealing of millions of dollars, this role can be easily abused by a stranger. On top of that, a moderator should have gained enormous amount of trust from the community and they should have significant "Good" report count on their account as well before even being considered for the role.eaLiTy is probably facing personal issues after the failure of FTX and we couldn't comment on their activity in the last few months. OTOH, Scammers have been targeting our board ever since the beginning and some way or the other we report these posts actively and the thread gets trashed immediately within a day.Quote from: Bureau on May 17, 2023, 02:19:44 PMI am ready to do it if consideredBe active for an year or two, gain trust from the community, prove that you won't abuse your position and more importantly report a lot of shitposts & threads for you to be considered for the role. P.S : If I'm not wrong @eaLiTy had a whooping 16k good reports at one point of time and for all this, he has been doing that selflessly without expecting anything in return.

comments.author: LucyFurr
comments.body: As a community, our top priority is to promote active engagement and constructive discussions among all members. While the importance of having moderators to supervise and regulate forums cannot be overstated, it may not be the most pressing requirement at this moment. Given the minimal posts and discussions so far, having voluntary members who can regularly contribute and stimulate conversations would be of tremendous value. The objective is to have a vibrant, engaging, and helpful community, which in turn can attract more active members.However, we understand that the risk of fraudulent activity remains a possibility, which is why we have a global moderator who can intervene when needed. Therefore, if you happen to encounter any fraudulent or suspicious activity within the community, do not hesitate to report it to avoid further escalation.Together, we can build a thriving community that fosters healthy interactions and mutual growth.

comments.author: light_warrior
comments.body: First, you can use the "Report to moderator" button to draw the moderator's attention to any infraction. Secondly, if you read the rules of the forum, it is clearly stated there that scams on the forum are not moderated and if you or anyone else were to send a report to a moderator on this topic, you would most likely get a bad report. And it's not about having a moderator. Even if you had one, he wouldn't delete this topic.

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: Good! Members like you take ownership and unwanted content to the mods. I had earlier reported a few and left a reply post on this thread. That topic had a bunch of malware links, and it was quickly removed from the board.Not all topics contain bad links. The topic you were referring to was more suitable on the service board, but I guess it was targeted to the Indian community. For that reason, instead of reporting it to the mods, I preferred responding to it. I wanted newbies to read those replies left by me and IIrik11 so that no one falls for such pump & dump schemes anywhere else. Ultimately, if you had not reported it, I would have done it. It's a good thing you did, and I hope in the future, more active members on our board will do what is right for the board.

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: After all the buzz, the post has been deleted finally. Even I keep reporting the posts which I come across as not relevant to the board or forum.Most of it are handled quickly. Although very few are unhandled yet I have managed to report few posts and here's my historyCode:You have reported 127 posts with 96% accuracy (117 good, 6 bad, 4 unhandled)At least 25% would be in the Indian board alone. As far as moderation is considered, it's being done correctly for the posts we report.Only thing is that we don't have an active moderator which I think is not required as long as the engagement is low on this board.
